The following code persists to the ASP.NET Session object.

member.name: M:Mono.Math.Prime.PrimalityTests.RabinMillerTest(Mono.Math.BigInteger,Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor)
member.summary: Probabilistic prime test based on Rabin-Miller's test

param.name: confidence
param.para: The number of chosen bases. The test has at least a 1/4^confidence chance of falsely returning True.

returns.para: True if "this" is a strong pseudoprime to randomly chosen bases.
False if "this" is definitely NOT prime.

member.name: T:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor
member.summary: A factor of confidence.

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.ExtraLow
member.summary: Only suitable for development use, probability of failure may be greater than 1/2^20.

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.Low
member.summary: Suitable only for transactions which do not require forward secrecy. Probability of failure about 1/2^40

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.Medium
member.summary: Designed for production use. Probability of failure about 1/2^80.

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.High
member.summary: Suitable for sensitive data. Probability of failure about 1/2^160.

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.ExtraHigh
member.summary: Use only if you have lots of time! Probability of failure about 1/2^320.

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.Provable
member.summary: Only use methods which generate provable primes. Not yet implemented.

member.name: T:Mono.Security.Cryptography.DHKeyGeneration
member.summary: Defines the different Diffie-Hellman key generation methods.

member.name: F:Mono.Security.Cryptography.DHKeyGeneration.Random
member.summary: Returns dynamically generated values for P and G. Unlike the Sophie Germain or DSA key generation methods, this method does not ensure that the selected prime offers an adequate security level.

member.name: F:Mono.Security.Cryptography.DHKeyGeneration.Static
member.summary: Returns values for P and G that are hard coded in this library. Contrary to what your intuition may tell you, using these hard coded values is perfectly safe. The values of the P and G parameters are taken from 'The OAKLEY Key Determination Protocol' [RFC2412]. This is the prefered key generation method, because it is very fast and very safe. Because this method uses fixed values for the P and G parameters, not all bit sizes are supported. The current implementation supports bit sizes of 768, 1024 and 1536.

member.name: T:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.OpenIdDesktopClient
member.summary: Provides OpenID client support for desktop applications.

remarks.para: The user's web browser will need to be launched to perform authentication. All data will be passed back to the application through an embedded web server that will only start as needed to receive the authentication response.

Use BeginAuthentication() to asynchronously start the temporary HTTP server and return the redirect URL. This URL should be passed to the client host and launched in its web browser. Use RetrieveAuthenticationResponse() to wait for the authentication response, or subscribe to the available events if blocking is not desired.
In either case, the HTTP server will be closed if the timeout has expired.

member.name: T:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.AXReceiver
member.summary: Receive and process unsolicited Attribute Exchange assertion messages.

remarks.para: Attribute Exchange specification supports subscribing to updates whenever changes are made to values stored at the OpenID Provider. Use AXReceiver to receive the updates whenever they are pushed out from the Provider.

Set AttributeExchange.UpdateUrl property during an Attribute Exchange Store request to subscribe to changes. If supported by the OpenID Provider, the URL specified in the UpdateUrl property will be automatically notified whenever the subscribed values change.
AttributeExchange.UpdateUrl should be set to the URL where AXReceiver is configured.

member.summary: Shared initialization method - should be used by constructor.

member.name: M:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.ClientCore.CreateRequest(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the redirect URL for the OpenID authentication request.
member.param: Automatically redirect the current HTTP session to the OpenID Provider.
member.returns: The redirect URL string that should be launched by the user's web browser.

remarks.para: Use Immediate mode to get an immediate response back from the OpenID Provider. This means the OpenID Provider will not prompt the user in any way, but will redirect the user's browser back with an authentication response. If the user is not currently logged in to the Provider, a "SetupNeeded" response will be received here at the client.

Set autoRedirect to true to automatically perform an HTTP redirect on the user's browser. This option is only valid in an ASP.NET environment. For all other environments, setting this value will have no effect.

member.name: M:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.ClientCore.EnableStatefulMode(ExtremeSwank.OpenId.IAssociationPersistence,ExtremeSwank.OpenId.ISessionPersistence)
member.summary: Enable Stateful authentication mode using supplied association and session persistence plug-ins.
member.param: IAssociationPersistence object to use while persisting associations from OpenID Providers.
ISessionPersistence object to use while persisting user session state.

member.name: M:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.ClientCore.ValidateResponse
member.summary: Validates an OpenID authentication response.

remarks.para: To determine if this method should be used, look at the value of the RequestedMode property, which detects the operational mode requested by the current HTTP request.
If RequestedMode is set to RequestedMode.IdResolution, the request is an authentication response from an OpenID Provider.
Therefore, ValidateResponse() should be used to verify the validity of the response.

member.returns: True if successfully validated, false if not.

member.name: T:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.OpenIdClient
member.summary: Provides an OpenID Relying Party (Consumer) compatible with OpenID 1.1 and 2.0 specifications.

member.name: M:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.OpenIdClient.CreateRequest
member.summary: Creates the redirect URL for the OpenID authentication request, and, if in an ASP.NET context, will automatically redirects the user's web browser to the OpenID Provider.
member.returns: The redirect URL string that should be launched by the user's web browser.
member.remarks: Uses standard "checkid_setup" mode for authentication. If user is not logged in to the OpenID Provider, the Provider is able to interact as needed.

member.name: M:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.OpenIdClient.CreateRequest(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the redirect URL for the OpenID authentication request.
member.param: Automatically redirect the current HTTP session to the OpenID Provider.
member.returns: The redirect URL string that should be launched by the user's web browser.

remarks.para: Use Immediate mode to get an immediate response back from the OpenID Provider. This means the OpenID Provider will not prompt the user in any way, but will redirect the user's browser back with an authentication response. If the user is not currently logged in to the Provider, a "SetupNeeded" response will be received here at the client.

Set autoRedirect to true to automatically perform an HTTP redirect on the user's browser. This option is only valid in an ASP.NET environment. For all other environments, setting this value will have no effect.

member.name: M:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.OpenIdClient.ValidateResponse
member.summary: Validates an OpenID authentication response.

remarks.para: To determine if this method should be used, look at the value of the RequestedMode property, which detects the operational mode requested by the current HTTP request.
If RequestedMode is set to RequestedMode.IdResolution, the request is an authentication response from an OpenID Provider.
Therefore, ValidateResponse() should be used to verify the validity of the response.

member.returns: True if successfully authenticated, false if not.

member.name: M:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.OpenIdClient.IsValidIdentity
member.summary: Independently performs discovery on the supplied OpenID and determines whether or not it is valid.
member.remarks: This is a free operation. If you invoke IsValidIdentity(), the discovered server URL is cached. Running CreateRequest() will skip server discovery and move directly on to redirect URL generation.
member.returns: True if discovery was successful, false if not.

member.name: T:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.PlugIns.Extensions.IdentityAuthentication
member.summary: Implements the optional "identity" and "claimed_id" fields. Loaded automatically by .

remarks.para: OpenID 2.0 includes support for extensions that do not necessarily require that an Identity be authenticated. This can be used in some cases where you want the Consumer and the OpenID Provider to exchange information that does not involve a specific user account.
As of this writing, there are currently no OpenID extensions which use this feature of the protocol.

This extension plug-in must be used for OpenID 1.1 servers, and is optional for OpenID 2.0 servers, under the conditions stated above. Should only be omitted if another Extension plug-in is used, and the extension in question does not require identity assertion.

member.remarks: If the response is found to be invalid, OpenIdClient will fail authentication validation.

member.name: T:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.AuthenticationMode
member.summary: Represents the mode used for authentication.

member.name: F:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.AuthenticationMode.Stateful
member.summary: Represents Stateful (smart) authentication.

remarks.para: In Stateful authentication, the client will first create a cached shared secret with the Identity Provider. An authentication request will then be passed to the Identity Provider through the user's web browser. Once the user has been authenticated at the Identity Provider, the response is sent back to the client through the web browser. The client will then verify the validity of the response using the cached shared secret.
Stateful mode requires less processing at the Identity Provider and gives faster response to the user.

member.name: F:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.AuthenticationMode.Stateless
member.summary: Represents Stateless (dumb) authentication.
member.remarks: In Stateless authentication, the authentication request is sent immediately to the Identity Provider through the user's web browser. The Identity Provider will authenticate the user and will eventually respond with the requested information, also passing the data through the web browser. The Consumer will then communicate with the Identity Provider directly to confirm the validity of the data.

member.summary: OpenIdUser data fields that are made available with the SimpleRegistration extension.

member.name: F:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.PlugIns.Extensions.SimpleRegistrationFields.Nickname
member.summary: Any UTF-8 string that the End User wants to use as a nickname.

member.name: F:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.PlugIns.Extensions.SimpleRegistrationFields.Email
member.summary: The email address of the End User as specified in section 3.4.1 of [RFC2822] (Resnick, P., Internet Message Format, .).

member.name: F:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.PlugIns.Extensions.SimpleRegistrationFields.FullName
member.summary: UTF-8 string free text representation of the End User's full name.

member.name: F:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.PlugIns.Extensions.SimpleRegistrationFields.DateOfBirth
member.summary: The End User's date of birth as YYYY-MM-DD. Any values whose representation uses fewer than the specified number of digits should be zero-padded. The length of this value MUST always be 10. If the End User user does not want to reveal any particular component of this value, it MUST be set to zero. For instance, if a End User wants to specify that his date of birth is in 1980, but not the month or day, the value returned SHALL be "1980-00-00".

member.name: F:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.PlugIns.Extensions.SimpleRegistrationFields.Gender
member.summary: The End User's gender, "M" for male, "F" for female.

member.name: F:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.PlugIns.Extensions.SimpleRegistrationFields.PostalCode
member.summary: UTF-8 string free text that SHOULD conform to the End User's country's postal system.

member.name: F:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.PlugIns.Extensions.SimpleRegistrationFields.Country
member.summary: The End User's country of residence as specified by ISO3166.

member.name: F:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.PlugIns.Extensions.SimpleRegistrationFields.Language
member.summary: End User's preferred language as specified by ISO639.

member.name: F:ExtremeSwank.OpenId.PlugIns.Extensions.SimpleRegistrationFields.TimeZone
member.summary: ASCII string from TimeZone database For example, "Europe/Paris" or "America/Los_Angeles".
